summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between Mark L. Epstein and attorney Andrew Heymann in 2020. The emails discuss logistics for Epstein to meet with someone named Darren in Florida, and Epstein's request to access Jeffrey Epstein's Paris apartment to secure family items and photos. The correspondence reveals post-mortem efforts to manage Epstein's affairs and access his properties.

persons.name: Mark L. Epstein
persons.role: Correspondent, likely family associate or executor
persons.context: He is communicating with attorney Andrew Heymann to arrange a face-to-face meeting with Darren in Florida and requests access to Jeffrey Epstein's Paris apartment to isolate family items and photos.

persons.name: Andrew Heymann
persons.role: Partner at Solomon Blum Heymann LLP
persons.context: He is the attorney corresponding with Mark L. Epstein, facilitating communication and logistics for meetings and forwarding mail.

persons.name: Darren
persons.role: Individual with whom Mark L. Epstein needs to meet
persons.context: Referenced as someone Epstein needs to speak with face-to-face in Florida; Andrew Heymann arranges an office appointment for him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier, subject of the case
persons.context: Referred to as 'Jeff' or 'JE'; his Paris apartment is the subject of Mark L. Epstein's access request to secure family items.

connections.description: Epstein is communicating with Heymann, a law firm partner, to arrange meetings and access properties, indicating a professional legal or advisory relationship.
Epstein states it is important to speak to Darren face-to-face about 'something of interest' that has come up, suggesting a substantive connection.
Mark L. Epstein is seeking access to Jeffrey Epstein's Paris apartment to secure family items and photos, implying a familial or close associative tie to Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
Heymann is coordinating a meeting between Darren and Mark L. Epstein, indicating Heymann has access to or works with Darren.

events.title: Mark L. Epstein's planned trip to Florida
events.description: Mark L. Epstein states he is flying to Florida on Saturday (Feb 15) and returning Tuesday (Feb 18) to meet with Darren face-to-face.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with Darren
events.description: Andrew Heymann arranges for Darren to see Mark L. Epstein at his office on Monday (Feb 17) from 9-11 AM.

events.title: Mark L. Epstein's planned trip to Paris
events.description: Mark L. Epstein plans to be in Paris from February 25 to 28 and requests access to Jeffrey Epstein's apartment there to isolate family items and photos.

keyFacts: Mark L. Epstein sought face-to-face meetings with an individual named Darren in Florida in February 2020 regarding 'something of interest' that had come up.
Mark L. Epstein requested access to Jeffrey Epstein's Paris apartment to 'isolate family items, and photos' to prevent them from disappearing or being dispersed.
The correspondence shows ongoing management of Jeffrey Epstein's affairs and access to his international properties after his death.
Attorney Andrew Heymann acted as an intermediary, handling mail forwarding and meeting logistics for Mark L. Epstein.
